channel.title: philstar.com - RSS Headlines
channel.description: Philippine News for the Filipino Global Community

item.title: CHR probes killing of retired soldier in Quezon City
item.author: Gaea Katreena Cabico
item.description: The Commission on Human Rights stressed that law enforcement personnel must always be respectful of human rights even in the face of national health emergency.

item.title: What Luzon could look like after April 30, according to UP experts
item.author: Ratziel San Juan
item.description: Here’s what researchers from the University of the Philippines have recommended to give you an idea of what the coming weeks might hold.

item.title: Trillanes: Cop drawing gun on Ragos 'is questionable already'
item.author: Kristine Joy Patag
item.description: That a police officer drew his gun at all on former soldier Winston Ragos for supposedly breaking quarantine guidelines is a matter for closer scrutiny, former Sen. Antonio Trillanes IV said.

item.title: QC cop who killed ex-soldier 'followed instruction' — PNP chief
item.author: Franco Luna
item.description: The chief of the national police defended the actions of a Quezon City cop involved in the killing of a former soldier on Tuesday afternoon, saying he was simply complying with instructions.

item.title: Phivolcs: Alert Level 1 still up over Taal amid series of quakes
item.description: Twenty-three volcano-tectonic earthquakes—with magnitudes between 1.2 and 3.7—were recorded in Mabini town and adjacent areas of Balayan Bay since 10:31 a.m. of Wednesday.

item.title: Ramadan to start on April 24
item.author: John Unson
item.description: Muslims in the country will start observing Friday the Ramadan season without nightly taraweeh prayer rites in mosques to ensure their safety from the deadly coronavirus.

item.title: Philippine Army probes police shooting of ex-soldier Ragos
item.description: Lt. Gen. Gilbert Gapay, Philippine Army commanding general, “ordered an investigation to be conducted by the Army Judge Advocate.”

item.title: Chinese Embassy slams Hontiveros' call for Beijing to shoulder Philippines' virus costs
item.description: (Update 1, 12:03 p.m.) Sen. Risa Hontiveros on Wednesday said China owes the country some P200 billion as a compensation for damaging the reef ecosystems in the West Philippine Sea.

item.title: Philippine Harvest trade fair gets online leg amid COVID-19
item.description: The annual Philippine Harvest Trade Fair that promotes and sells local food products shifted to online platform amid the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: Actual COVID-19 cases in the Philippines around 9,000 — experts
item.author: Ratziel San Juan
item.description: In a policy report released Wednesday night, UP experts said that "there could as many 9,000 people" carrying the virus that causes COVID-19 as of Sunday.
